newsitem.title: THAILAND: General Finance, Caspian in broker deal.
newsitem.headline: General Finance, Caspian in broker deal.

text.p: Thailand's General Finance and Securities Plc has signed a securities services deal with Britain's Caspian Securities Co Ltd, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.
General Finance has also renewed links and is placing orders for sub-broker Peregrine Nithi Finance and Securities Ltd, the statement said.
General Finance believes the contracts should enable its market share of securities trading in Thailand to rise to 2.50 percent in 1997 against 2.19 percent in 1996.
General Finance already places orders on behalf of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell and has a securities co-operation agreement with regional merchant bank PrimeEast Capital Group.
After establishing operations in South and North America since its creation in 1995, Caspian Securities Co Ltd has been expanding its Asian coverage over the last 12 months.
The firm, which specialises in emerging markets, already has offices in Bangkok, Malaysia, Hong Kong and India.
